description: The mathematical proportion found in nature and classical art.

discovery.text: The golden spiral suggests a focal point and a natural path for the eye. Place your main subject where the spiral tightens and arrange supporting elements along the curve.

twist.text: The golden ratio's presence in masterworks is often overstated. Many examples are retrofitted â€” a spiral can be stretched to fit almost anything. But as a compositional starting point, it genuinely produces pleasing results.

climax.text: Don't stress about precise mathematical placement. The golden ratio and rule of thirds produce similar results. Use whichever feels more intuitive â€” both push you toward off-center, dynamic compositions.

punchline.text: Nature uses the golden ratio. You can too. But don't worship it â€” use it as a starting point.
